node.title: postprocessor/csv output of CZM interface materials
node.bodyText:
Dear all,
I'm doing some work with the CZM interface implementation, but could not find a proper way to output material property values that are defined on the boundary interface into a csv. Or better, I can export them from the exodus file (extracting along a line from Paraview), but I'd prefer to output those directly via a (vector)postprocessor (or similar) at specified locations (to maintain flexible output intervals for the full model solution and the postprocessor). Does such a functionality exist in the framework? Thanks for any hint/clue etc ...
Mauro

Hello
What you want is the equivalent of this for a boundary
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/vectorpostprocessors/MaterialVectorPostprocessor.html
We unfortunately do not have this implemented. It would be very useful and we would love to have that.
Would you want to develop this?
Guillaume

node.title: Have a problem in XFEM
node.bodyText:
When calculating the crack, I don't know why the following error occurs. How should I solve it?
*** ERROR ***
Attemping to add intersection to an invalid fragment edge. Element: 4019 fragment_edge: 4
@hugary1995
tbis is not a trival error. it means the cut algorithm fails to add a cut to one element. it can be caused by multiple cuts, or some wired cutting locations.
Should I reduce the time step at this point? I would like to know what I should do next to fix this
when does this appear? At initialization or on the first time step or later?
It happened after I calculated it for a while.

ok use a checkpoint ouptut and restart (see this: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/outputs/Checkpoint.html) maybe a few time steps before the problem occurs.
Then try to fiddle with the time step or solve parameters.
If this does not work, then actually maybe re-mesh the geometry?
@jiangwen84 what do you think?
I tried to reduce the time step, but the question still arises, should I go to the encrypted mesh?
what do you mean by encrypted?
xfem does not support checkpoint. share with us your input file and I might be able to take a look.
Add more nodes to make the grid smaller and thinner

input.zip
I compressed the sub-card into an installation package, where the grid of the card is a cross-section of the wall of a pipe, divided into three layers. I transferred the temperature and displacement to the sub-card in the main card in 3D, and the settings of the XFEM part are very I show below：
[XFEM]
    geometric_cut_userobjects = 'cut_mesh'
    qrule = volfrac
    output_cut_plane = true
  []
  [DomainIntegral]
    integrals = 'Jintegral InteractionIntegralKI InteractionIntegralKII'
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    crack_front_points_provider = cut_mesh
    2d=true
    number_points_from_provider = 0
    crack_direction_method = CurvedCrackFront
    radius_inner = '0.01'
    radius_outer = '0.03'
    youngs_modulus = 207000
    poissons_ratio = 0.3
    #block = 'TC'
    incremental = true
    used_by_xfem_to_grow_crack = true
  []


  [UserObjects]
    inactive = 'line_seg_cut_uo xfem_marker_uo'
    [./line_seg_cut_uo]
      type = LineSegmentCutSetUserObject
      cut_data = '-2e-4   -2e-04   -1.75e-04 -2.025e-04  0.0  3600
                  -1.6e-4   -2.03e-04   -1.5e-04 -2.05e-04  5000 7200
                  -1.45e-4   -2.06e-04   -1.2e-04 -2.03e-04  7200  10800
                  -1.2e-4   -2.03e-04   -1e-04 -2e-04  10800  14400
                  -1e-4   -1.5e-04   0      -2e-04  14400   144000'
    [../]
    [./xfem_marker_uo]
      type = XFEMRankTwoTensorMarkerUserObject
      execute_on = timestep_end
      tensor = stress
      scalar_type = MaxPrincipal
      threshold = strength
      average = true
    [../]
    [nucleate]
      type = MeshCut2DRankTwoTensorNucleation
      tensor = stress
      #scalar_type = VonMisesStress
      #initiate_on_boundary = tgo_tc
      scalar_type = MaxPrincipal
      nucleation_threshold = strength
      nucleation_length = 0.001
      #edge_extension_factor = 2e-5
      nucleate_across_full_element = true
      []
    [cut_mesh]
      type = MeshCut2DFractureUserObject
      mesh_file = make_edge_crack_in.e
      k_critical= 80
      growth_increment = 0.001
      nucleate_uo = nucleate
    []

  []

node.title: How to assign values?
node.bodyText: Hello, I want to assign a value to a variable in a certain area at a certain time. Is there any way of doing this?

You could use a ParsedAux with an expression like:
expression = 'if( abs(t - t_0) < 0.001 && (spatial conditions), the_value_to_assign, regular_value_of_the_variable)'
you can also use the TimesEnableControl for handle the 'certain time" aspect
Can you use a block restriction for the "certain area" ?

Thank you for your reply, but this is not what I was looking for. What I'm going to do is assign zero values to all the stresses and deformations in a given region. Instead of setting auxiliary variables. I don't know if there's a way to do that.

What I'm going to do is assign zero values to all the stresses

what are the stresses? Arent they material properties?
deformations are displacements right, so they are nonlinear variables?
Yes, it's a nonlinear variable. I only found a way to set the initial conditions. Is there a way to set it at a certain time?

To set  nonlinear variables during the solve, you'll need to create a user object.
There are no auxkernels like for auxiliary variables.
There's no way to do that right now, is there? If I want to add this feature. Do you have any good suggestions?

There are no existing ways.
You can look at the PointwiseRenormalizeVector userobject. This is probably the best example
Hello, when I use the restart function. How to combine two output files into one?

you can use the solutionUserObject for these mixes
then SOlutionAux can change  the aux variables, solutionIC can be tried for nonlinear variables

node.title: Value requested for nonexistent variable
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I am runing a coupled simulation in serial manner (not parallel). I need to call two outputs from previous steps to initialise my current model. I applyed "SolutionUserObject" to reed the data from the each outputs (I did not use "restart" because i needed to have the data in the functions). here is the blocks in input file:
[UserObjects]
  [./solution_1] 
    type = SolutionUserObject
    mesh = output1.e
    timestep = LATEST
    system_variables = 'sigma_xx sigma_xy sigma_xz sigma_yy sigma_yz sigma_zz'
  [../]
     [./solution_2] 
    type = SolutionUserObject
    mesh = output2.e
    timestep = LATEST
    system_variables = 'stress_xx stress_xy stress_xz stress_yx stress_yy stress_yz stress_zx stress_zy stress_zz pressure temperature'
  [../]
[]

But the run terminates with the following error, while  'stress_zz' is in the list of available variables, it is shown as nonexistent variable.
 Currently Executing
  Performing Initial Setup................................................

*** ERROR ***
/export/dump/rahim/init_seissol-first.i:47.6:
The following error occurred in the UserObject 'solution_2' of type SolutionUserObject.

Value requested for nonexistent variable ' stress_zz' in the 'solution_2' SolutionUserObject.
System selected: nl0
Available variables:
 stress_xx, stress_xy, stress_xz, stress_yx, stress_yy, stress_yz, stress_zx, stress_zy, stress_zz, pressure, temperature


application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 42

Thanks,
Rahim

Hello
I m surprised the stresses are all in the 'nl0' (nonlinear) system.
Should you be pulling from the auxiliary system instead?
Also I think the problem does not come from the solution user object, but from the SolutionIC or SolutionAux which instead of specifying 'stress_zz' specified ' stress_zz'

Thanks @GiudGiud ,
I have tried 'stress_zz' instead of ' stress_zz' and it worked.
Rahim

node.title: Random Nucleation within grain boundaries
node.bodyText:
Hello MOOSE members,
I am currently working on dynamic re-crystallization and need to develop a basic model for random nucleation within grain boundaries. I've used BoundingBoxIC to initiate the initial grain structure (4 grains) and now need to place some nuclei inside the grain boundaries randomly.
My approach involves considering the "bnds" values. This means if the "bnds" are between 0 and 1, the nucleus values are 1, otherwise they are 0. However, the issue is that the "bnds" are calculated within AuxKernels while the nucleus_value = 1 is set in the main Kernel. Is it possible to pass variables within blocks?
#-------- here is the example code---------------------------------------
[Mesh]
    # Mesh block.  Meshes can be read in or automatically generated
    type = GeneratedMesh
    dim = 2 # Problem dimension
    nx = 500 # Number of elements in the x-direction
    ny = 500 # Number of elements in the y-direction
    xmax = 250 # maximum x-coordinate of the mesh
    ymax = 250 # maximum y-coordinate of the mesh
    elem_type = QUAD4 # Type of elements used in the mesh
    #uniform_refine = 2 # Initial uniform refinement of the mesh
  
    parallel_type = replicated # Periodic BCs
  []
  [GlobalParams]
    # Parameters used by several kernels that are defined globally to simplify input file
    op_num = 4 # Number of grains
    var_name_base = gr # Base name of grains
    
      order = FIRST
      family = LAGRANGE
      
  []
  [Variables]
    #[./gr2]
     #order = FIRST
    # #family = LAGRANGE
    #[../]
      #[./gr1]
     #order = FIRST
     #family = LAGRANGE
    #[../]
      #[./gr0]
     #order = FIRST
     #family = LAGRANGE
    #[../]
    #[./gr0]
    #[../]

    
    [./PolycrystalVariables]

    [../]
  []

  [Modules]
    [./PhaseField]
      [./GrainGrowth]
        variable_mobility = false
      [../]
    [../]
  []

  [ICs]
  [./gr0]
    y2 = 125
    y1 = 0
    inside = 1.0
    outside = 0
    x2 = 125
    variable = gr0
    int_width = 4
    x1 = 0
    type = BoundingBoxIC
  [../]
    [./gr1]
      y2 = 125
      y1 = 0
      inside = 1.0
      outside = 0
      x2 = 250
      variable = gr1
      x1 = 125
      int_width = 4
      type = BoundingBoxIC
    [../]
    [./gr2]
      y2 = 250
      y1 = 125
      inside = 1.0
      outside = 0
      x2 = 250
      variable = gr2
      x1 = 0
      int_width = 4
      type = BoundingBoxIC
    [../]
  
  []

[AuxVariables]
  [./bnds]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
    
  [../]

[]
[AuxKernels]
  [./BndsCalc]
    type = BndsCalcAux
    variable = bnds
    
    execute_on = timestep_end
    
  [../]

[]




  
  [Kernels]
      
    [./c_force]
    
      type = DiscreteNucleationForce
      variable = gr3
      map = map
     
      no_nucleus_value = 0
      nucleus_value = 1

    [../]
    
   
      [./PolycrystalKernel]
      
      [../]
  []
  
  [UserObjects]
  [./inserter]
    type = DiscreteNucleationInserter
    hold_time = 10
    probability = 0.001
    seed = 12346
    radius = 3.27
  [../]
    [./map]
      type = DiscreteNucleationMap
      int_width = 4
      inserter = inserter
    [../]


  []

  

#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  [Materials]
    [CuGrGr]
      # Material properties
      type = GBEvolution # Quantitative material properties for copper grain growth.  Dimensions are nm and ns
      GBmob0 = 2.5e-6 # Mobility prefactor for Cu from schonfelder1997molecular bibtex entry
      GBenergy = 0.2 # GB energy for Cu from schonfelder1997molecular bibtex entry
      Q = 0.23 # Activation energy for grain growth from Schonfelder 1997
      T = 500 # Constant temperature of the simulation (for mobility calculation)
      wGB = 4 # Width of the diffuse GB
    []

  []
  






  #-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  [Executioner]
  type = Transient
  scheme = BDF2
  solve_type = 'newton'
 
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -ksp_grmres_restart -sub_ksp_type -sub_pc_type -pc_asm_overlap'
  petsc_options_value = 'asm      31                  preonly       lu           1'
  l_max_its = 30
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-9
  l_tol = 1e-7
  nl_max_its = 30
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-9
 
  start_time = 0.0
  end_time = 4000
  dtmax=0.5
  

  []
  
  [Outputs]
    execute_on = 'timestep_end'
    exodus = true
  []

Hello
What do you mean by

s it possible to pass variables within blocks

do you mean objects would use the value of a variable?
This is certainly possible for many objects, but they have to be coded for that purpose. For example, see all the Coupled.... kernels
Guillaume

@GiudGiud thank you for your prompt reply.
What I intend to do is, after calculating the 'bnds', set 'nucleus_value' to 1 if 'bnds' falls between 0 and 1, otherwise set it to zero. However, the issue I'm encountering is how to specify a condition within the Kernel block while computing 'bnds' values inside AuxKernels.

the initial conditions are not specified in the kernels block, they are specified in the ICs block. They can also be set a little hackily in the auxkernel block
Is nucleus_value a variable?
@GiudGiud , Yes it is a variable which is in  double data type.Variable value indicating the presence of a nucleus.

Unfortunately a double data type is not a field variable.
I would rewrite the kernel to use afield variable if you want this local dependency on the values of bnds
@GiudGiud ,Thank you very much. this was the problem I was facing.
@GiudGiud could you please help me with this matter? I mean how to get local dependency of bnds(Auxkernel)

bnds(Auxkernel) ? What do you mean by that?
Do you need to bound an aux-variable now?
Or is this still an input problem where you want to use a field variable instead of a single number?

node.title: Using Tabulated fluid properties without another fluid
node.bodyText:
Hi there,
I am trying to get tabulated data to work in one of my input files,  however it doesnt seem to work.
I have tried it in a couple ways, see below for one:
  [he]
    type = SimpleFluidProperties
  []

  [he_tab]
    type = TabulatedBicubicFluidProperties
    fluid_property_file = '../csv_store/coolant_salt_tab.csv'
    fp = he
    allow_fp_and_tabulation = true

    interpolated_properties = 'density viscosity k cp cv internal_energy'

    out_of_bounds_behavior = set_to_closest_bound
    error_on_out_of_bounds = false

    construct_pT_from_vh = false
    construct_pT_from_ve = false

    # Tabulation range
    temperature_min = 450
    temperature_max = 845
    pressure_min = 100000.0
    pressure_max = 12000000.0

    # Newton parameters
    tolerance = 1e-8
    T_initial_guess = 647.5
    p_initial_guess = 4000000.0
  []

I have tried it without the extra fp object, as well as linearfluid properties, but none seem to work.
Also, the option for specific volume doesnt seem to exist?
Note: The fluid is not helium, it is a ternary chloride salt - so I need it to be treated as a liquid

Hello
We will need the exact error messages you are hitting.
It should work, especially with the latest rework.
Did you make sure to use an updated moose from basically yesterday? Because a lot of the parameters you are using were merged this week.
Guillaume

I just pulled and made from main, so I should have the most updated.
Im getting a couple different ones as I try a variety of things, the latest of which are:
**Method 1:  Just tabulated fluid properties **
... reading the following properties : 'density viscosity k cp cv internal_energy v'
... I have set the name of "v" to be "specifc_volume" also.
 *** ERROR ***
 /root/projects/ORCA/models/systems/2_HTGR/5_scaled_power/p4_tabulated_fp_coolant.i:422.3:
 The following error occurred in the FluidProperties 'he' of type TabulatedBicubicFluidProperties.
 
 virtual void TabulatedFluidProperties::p_from_v_e(libMesh::Real, libMesh::Real, libMesh::Real&, libMesh::Real&, libMesh::Real&) const
 No tabulation or fluid property 'fp' object to compute value

**Method 2:  Pairing with linearfluidproperties **
... It does NOT run if I leave linear props empty, as is requesting parameters
... it runs with some reference values taken from the csv but fails to converge.
... There were also a couple other not implemented errors, but this could be the consequence of something else
For context, the system is a 90MWth primary and secondary (open brayton), where the original primary fluid was helium and we are now trying to change it to a system with a ternary coolant salt. It ran well before changing the fluid medium. If you think we are barking up the wrong tree, please let me know!

Ok so option 1 needs a ve tabulation file if you want to use with code that requests p_from_ve.
You can generate that on your own or you can use additional parameters in the TFP (create_ve_tabulation) to do it
In option 2 those calls that are not known to the pT tabulation (the only one you provided) are forwarded to the fp object, which is why it does not error.
The documentation for TFP is fairly extensive and describes the 3 ways you can use this.
Are you using the thermal hydraulics module for this ternary salt loop?

Thank you GG, I will have a look at generating a ve tabulation file in one way or another.
I would prefer to use option one, so will test this and get back to you.
Also,
I am using thm for the salt loop! I can send parts of my input file if it will be helpful
Sounds good. Lemme know if you hit more errors. For this object at this point, it's more a matter of inputting different parameters than developing new things

Making progress! However, I cant see why I am getting this error:

*** ERROR ***
/root/projects/ORCA/models/systems/2_HTGR/5_scaled_power/p4_gas_dT_25.i:438.3:
The following parameter error occurred in the FluidProperties 'he' of type TabulatedBicubicFluidProperties.
fp: No fluid properties or csv data provided for density.

... I am providing density data, so Im not sure why it is saying this.
I have also had to fix internal energy as it doesnt seem to like it being different for different specific volumes?

ok so I ll modify the error to make that clear, but is it density(p,T) or density(v,e) that is crashing? and are you providing both in both pT and ve tabulations?

I have also had to fix internal energy as it doesnt seem to like it being different for different specific volumes?

That does not seem right. It should form a grid in the ve tabulation.
Something like
v1 e1
v1 e2
v1 e3
v2 e1
v2 e2
v2 e3
v3 e1
...

ok so I ll modify the error to make that clear, but is it density(p,T) or density(v,e) that is crashing? and are you providing both in both pT and ve tabulations?

Im only providing ve:
  [he]
    type = TabulatedBicubicFluidProperties
    fluid_property_ve_file = "../csv_store/coolant_salt_tab.csv"
    interpolated_properties = 'internal_energy pressure temperature density viscosity k c cv cp entropy'
    create_ve_interpolations = true
    create_pT_interpolations = false
    out_of_bounds_behavior = set_to_closest_bound
  []

//
But yes, that v1 v2 v3 ... is how my csv is laid out

Weird
I can take a look when I get back this afternoon
The more you can share with me the better, I ll need to be able to get to the error

node.title: The coupled heat source from openmc cannot act on the temperature field
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone!
I have installed and deployed cardinal-moose-openmc and run it successfully. When running the example, I found a problem. The temperature field in moose solid seems to be affected by the power value of 1000, and the calculated heat source (power 1e7) does not act on the temperature field.
The heat source calculated by openmc exists in the form of auxvariables, but the heatsource kernel seems to only support equations and value. How to set the auxiliary variables as internal heat sources?
Thanks in advance!

hello
you can use this kernel to input a force term (here a heat source) from a variable
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/kernels/CoupledForce.html

node.title: TimedSubdomainModifier at time zero
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
Hello,
I would like to check whether this was intended. If the time is set to zero, then the subdomain change does not occur. Below is an example file, where subdomains 2 and 3 are changing to subdomain 1 at times 0 and 1 respectively. Subdomain 3 changes, but subdomain 2 remains the same for the whole simulation. Was this because a subdomain change for a whole block shouldn't occur at time zero?
Thank you.
[Problem]
  solve = false
[]

[Mesh]
  [gen]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 2
    xmax = 3
    ymax = 1
    nx = 3
    ny = 1
  []
  [left]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'gen'
    block_id = 1
    bottom_left = '0 0 0'
    top_right = '1 1 0'
  []
  [middle]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'left'
    block_id = 2
    bottom_left = '1 0 0'
    top_right = '2 1 0'
  []
  [right]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'middle'
    block_id = 3
    bottom_left = '2 0 0'
    top_right = '3 1 0'
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [dummy]
  []
[]

[UserObjects]
  [block_change]
    type = TimedSubdomainModifier
    times = '0 1'
    blocks_from = '2 3'
    blocks_to = '1 1'
    execute_on = 'INITIAL TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  dt = 1
  end_time = 2
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]

Hello
I think this might have been a miss. I ll check and create an issue
If you need this, you can set a start_time to the simulation before 0
Guillaume
Is there any news on this yet?

I created an issue
#28132
the workaround being so simple, it's not a priority to change this

node.title: PorousFlow mechanics with an empty pipe in a porous medium
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I have a functioning input file for a TH-problem where a heat-source is placed in a porous medium. The heat-source is a fluid filled pipe, the thermal processes in the pipe are currently calculated by simple HeatConduction Kernels outside of the PorousFlow module.
How would I proceed to incorporate mechanics in order to investigate consolidation of the porous medium surrounding the pipe?

Well, you just need to couple the mechanical part to your model
For a THM problem look at modules/porous_flow/examples/tutorial/04.i and for the consolidation problem here modules/porous_flow/test/tests/poro_elasticity/terzaghi_constM.i

Thank you for your reply. For the porous medium I already have the blocks accordingly to the tutorials. The question is how to consider the mechanics for the pipe, as stress would also be taken and transferred by the pipe, and it would also be displaced when the underlying soil is consolidated.
I probably phrased this a little bit unclear in the initial question.

With TransientMultiApps maybe? (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/MultiApps/index.html). With two input files one for your porous medium and one for your pipe. You need to transfer data from one to the other. But this is not fully coupled.
Iterative coupling with multiapp s is "tight coupling" and it converges to the same answer as full coupling (single matrix approach)

I've got the mechanics running so far, however the results seem a little counterintuitive.
The calculated stresses are positive, per convention this means they are expansive rather than compressive. Correspondingly, the resulting displacements are positive as well.

test.txt
I guess this comes from the pore pressure being calculated by porepressure = airpressure (1 atm) - capillary pressure (here roughly 15kPa)
This leads to a positive porepressure larger than the calculated stresses and thus expansion.
However, porepressure is normally given by rho_w  * g * z and with the density of water smaller than of that soil should yield negative stresses. Am I missing something here?

Giving this a push, as I am somewhat on a schedule.
Looking at #23541 and the other threads cited by @WilkAndy a porepressure of 0 corresponds to atmospheric pressure and negative porepressures to an unsaturated medium - this does not seem to be the case here. I've created a simplified model of the problem described above using a single phase with porepressure as main variable and with this I am now able to achieve the desired results. This is fine for me.
However, the question still remains if this is actually achievable with the NCG model?
@cpgr
